place.name: BALDHU
place.gazetteerText: BALDHU, a chapelry in Kea and Kenwyn parishes, Cornwall; in the northern vicinity of Truro r. station Post Town, Truro. Rated property, £2,000. Pop. 2,070. Houses, 427. The property is not much divided The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Exeter. Value, £200.* Patron, Viscount Falmouth. The church is very good. The chapelry was constituted in 1846. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
